column2: No quick fix in U.S. bid to end reliance on Russian rocket engines WASHINGTON
column3: Sept 21 The U.S. drive to end its reliance on Russian rocket motors got a boost this week when Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos unveiled a new engine project
column4: but officials and industry insiders say it will take years and hundreds of millions of dollars to develop a locally built alternative.

column2: Julius Baer eyes Coutts international arm
column4: Sept 21 Swiss private bank Julius Baer  is interested in acquiring Coutts International
column5: a unit of Royal Bank of Scotland
column6: but will not get into a bidding war for the venerable British bank's overseas arm
column7: a Swiss paper reported on Sunday.

column2: General Motors recalls cars over parking brake fire risk WASHINGTON
column3: Sept 21 U.S. car manufacturer General Motors Co is recalling hundreds of thousands of cars over a defect in the parking brake that could cause a fire
column4: a letter by the top U.S. auto safety regulator showed.

column2: Microsoft delays launch of its Xbox One console in China BEIJING
column3: Sept 21 Microsoft Corp has delayed the launch of its Xbox One game console in China
column4: which had been set for release on Tuesday
column5: but the world's biggest software company said it would be released by the end of the year.
